# MKMapSnapshotter

**Class**

A utility class for capturing a map and its content into an image.

## Declaration

```swift
class MKMapSnapshotter
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapSnapshotter] object when you want to capture the system-provided map content, including the map tiles and imagery. The snapshotter object captures the best image possible by loading all of the available map tiles before capturing the image.

Configure a snapshotter object using an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKMapSnapshotter/Options] object. The snapshot options specify the appearance of the map, including which portion of the map the snapshotter captures.



## Creating a snapshotter object

- **init(options:)**: Creates and returns a snapshotter object based on the specified options.
- **MKMapSnapshotter.Options**: The options the snapshotter initializer uses to create a snapshotter to capture map-based imagery.

## Generating a snapshot

- **start(completionHandler:)**: Submits the request to create a snapshot and delivers the results to the specified block.
- **start(with:completionHandler:)**: Submits the request to create a snapshot and executes the resulting block on the specified queue.
- **MKMapSnapshotter.CompletionHandler**: A block that processes the results of a snapshot request.
- **cancel()**: Cancels the request to create a snapshot.
- **isLoading**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the snapshotter is generating an image.

## Snapshot output

- **MKMapSnapshotter.Snapshot**: An image that a snapshotter object generates.

## Static map snapshots

- **MKMapSnapshotter.Snapshot**: An image that a snapshotter object generates.

- NSObject
